text: I think it would be a worthwhile exercise to look at how much we, as a company actively making things in this space, have used any of the connected parts of our current fridge.

attachments.title: ChefSteps Debuts Joule
attachments.text: Introducing Joule, the sous vide tool that changes everything. Controlled by a groundbreaking custom app, Joule is a sleek, powerful cooking tool that makes sous vide a real part of today’s kitchen.

text: <@U0265G76F>: I rebooted it last week. It hasn't been connected since before I started
Since then I've ignored AP stories if that counts as use
I connected it to the Samsung TV in echo once
It wasn't worth the hour that it took
Also it worked once, but then stopped for no reason

some aspects of joule interesting: the magnetic foot seems like a good idea. the ability to start the water heating is useful since that might take an hour with a big pot of water. I'm not familiar with that type of heater
I'm heading down to CES tomorrow, if there's anything anyone wants me to go check out in person (and arm me with questions to grill sales reps) let me know.

attachments.title: Teslasuit - feel what you play
attachments.fallback: Teslasuit: Teslasuit - feel what you play

text: wonder if we should get our logo trademarked. :simple_smile:
also sony’s already doing the haptic suit for Rez VR <https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CVfr0s5VAAEuxzF.jpg:large>
